title: UK to fly back 7,000 people as Thomas Cook repatriation efforts enter 2nd week
text:
UK to fly back 7,000 people as Thomas Cook repatriation efforts enter 2nd week

Stock Markets 9 minutes ago (Oct 01, 2019 05:46)

(Reuters) - Britain's Civil Aviation Authority on Tuesday said 39 flights are scheduled to bring back a further 7,000 people to the country after the Thomas Cook collapse, as the operation enters its second week. So far 115,000 customers of a total of more than 150,000 passengers have returned in the largest peacetime repatriation 'Operation Matterhorn', which was launched on Sept 23.

UK to fly back 7,000 people as Thomas Cook repatriation efforts enter 2nd week
description: UK to fly back 7,000 people as Thomas Cook repatriation efforts enter 2nd week
